column2: Toride is bordered by Chiba Prefecture to the south. The Tone River passes along the southern border of Toride
column3: which also marks the Ibaraki/Chiba border. It is approximately 40 kilometers from central Tokyo.

column1: Toride developed in the Edo period as a post town on the Mito Kaido highway connecting Edo with Mito. Toride town was created with the establishment of the municipalities system on April 1
column2: 1889. It was elevated to city status on October 1
column5: the neighboring town of Fujishiro (from Kitasōma District) was merged into Toride

column1: Due to its proximity to Tokyo
column2: Toride is increasingly a bedroom community for the Tokyo metropolis.

column1: Toride has ten public and one private elementary schools
column2: six public and two private middle schools and five public and two private high schools. In addition
column3: the Tokyo University of the Arts maintains a campus at Toride.
